intro: Nepeta tuberosa var. gienensis, commonly known as Gienensian catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features aromatic, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in gardens for its fragrance and pollinator attraction. This variety is closely related to other catmint species and shares similar horticultural characteristics.
